intro: Tracyanthus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed tracyanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a compact cluster. Tracyanthus angustifolius is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique type of shrubland ecosystem.
